AccountingPointAdditionalAddressApiModel.description:
AccountingPoint additional address
Contains addresses which related with accounting point

heatingDependingOnElectricity.description:
Heating depending on electricity
Compulsory for consumption accounting point.

reactiveEnergy.description:
Reactive energy
The data Reactive energy time series available is not relayed in the accounting point event.
Datahub concludes this data based on received metering data.

estimatedAnnualConsumption.description:
Estimated Annual Consumption
Case when AccountingPoint.Characteristic.CounterValueType equal EstimatedAnnualConsumption
Always given in kilowatt-hours.

estimatedAnnualConsumption2.description:
Estimated Annual Consumption 2
Case when AccountingPoint.Characteristic.CounterValueType equal EstimatedAnnualConsumption
and AccountingPoint.Characteristic.TimeDivision equal TwoRateMeteringNightDay or TwoRateMeteringWinterDayOther
Estimated annual consumption 2 can only be reported if also estimated annual consumption 1 has been reported.

subGroup.description:
Sub group
DSO specific additional info used to handle the automatically establishment process

tierOfConnectedAccountingPoints.description:
TierOfConnectedAccountingPoints
Describes how many ACPs are connected to the same Connection Point
Needed to determine the correct fixed fees, which might (vendor related) depend on the number of ACPs under the same Connection Point

mainCustomerId.description:
Used for Customer identification
More information about customer IDocumentCustomer
Related with Customer.Id for more info CIS.Core.Api.Model.Customers.Responses.CustomerResponse.Id

additionalCustomerIds.description:
Additional Customer Ids linked to CIS Customer Id
More information about vendor IDocumentCustomer
It is mainly used in specific Finnish cases where the agreement contains more than one customer.
In these cases, there is no difference between main and additional customers.

invoiceConfigurationId.description:
Invoice configuration Id
More information invoice configuration Id

vendorId.description:
Vendor Id
Company registered on market related with accounting point
More information about vendor IDocumentCustomVendorData

startDate.description:
Agreement start date
Start date is inclusive
            
Start date 2023-01-01 expected on request in format "2022-12-31T22:00:00.000Z" or "2023-01-01T00:00:00.000+02:00"
Time zone information are inside time zone configuration and in this case it is Europe/Helsinki
This format is return in response "2022-12-31T22:00:00.000Z"

endDate.description:
Agreement end date
End date is exclusive
Used mainly for fixed term agreements
            
End Date 2023-12-31 expected on request in format "2023-12-30T21:59:59.999Z" or "2023-12-30T23:59:59.999+02:00"
Time zone information are inside time zone configuration and in this case it is Europe/Helsinki
This format is return in response "2023-12-30T21:59:59.999Z"

DistributionMethodApiModel.description:
Distribution method
Different in different countries and depending on invoice operator's services
FINLAND:
AI01 = Paper invoice
AI02 = Electronic invoice
AI03 = E-invoice
AI04 = E - mail
AI05 = Omaposti(ex.Netposti)
AI06 = Direct debit
AI07 = Mobile invoice
AI08 = Other channel(e.g.Online service)

DistributionMethodConfigurationApiModel.description:
Distribution method configuration
- configuration to each distribution method that is enabled, e.g. what is the email address used for email distribution method
- needed also additional distribution methods and configurations: e.g.how to send invoice copy and reminder

application.description:
Application
api, workflow function, integration app

processId.description:
Process Id
workflow instance ID, app process identifier or correlation id

country.description:
Country
fi, no, se   etc... / iso-3611 2 char

ElectronicContactChannelApiModel.description: Electronic contact channel type - phone included

variables.description: Variables. If array is provided, it's attempted to be converted to array of decimal values.

context.description: Context variables like price table id, etc

formula.description:
Formula is the mathematical representation of what do we want to compute. Various elements can be combined together, there is no predefined set of formulas. The expression formula can contain functions, operators and parameters, which are mapped from ParameterMapping.
There are APIs that provide all available elements elements: /common/expression/functions, /common/expression/variables, /common/expression/operators
Every usage within CIS.Core.Api.Model.ProductComponents.Requests.ProductComponentRequest must be returning number. Other use cases vary (CIS.Core.Api.Model.AgreementTemplateRules.Requests.AgreementTemplateRuleRequest / CIS.Core.Api.Model.Expressions.DecisionPropertyApiModel) ``` 42 true consumption_hourly_active aboveLimit(avgOfHighest(active_power,3),5) if(max(power_r) - 0.20 * max(power_a) < 0, 0, limit - 0.20 * max(power_a)) positiveOrZero(series_max(\"reactive_energy_input\", start_date, end_date, window_size) - 0.4 * series_max(\"active_energy\", start_date, end_date, window_size) ```

parameterMapping.description:
Configures data sources of variables used in Formula
See /common/expression/variables for available variables.
Additionally, Agreement fixed variables present in CIS.Core.Api.Model.Agreements.Requests.ProductReferenceRequest.Variables might be used.

hubIdentification.description:
Identification
GLN number
The Global Location Number (GLN) is a 13 digit globally unique identifier for any location, physical, operational, or legal, that needs to be identified for use in the supply chain. Once identified, GLNs can then be used for retrieving information from databases.

name.description:

Format used based on procedural guidelines for messaging:
(number of cables) x (number of phases) x (amperes)
The number of cables is excluded if only one cable is in use.

Not fixed invoice date

distributionMethods.description:
Distribution methods
It must not contain part of the configuration (DistributionMethodConfiguration) because it is related to user data
eg. value of user DirectDebit, user EInvoice, user MobileInvoice cannot be part of invoice management

InvoicePaymentStatusApiModel.description:
Invoice payment status 
Depending on AR service partner's solution and their statuses for different actions.
Can be updated to Cloud-CIS Invoice from external AR solution.
Invoice payment status is updated in service partner's solution and depending on what kind of API's AR service partner can provide, we can fetch
some information back to Cloud-CIS Customer service UI (perhaps not in 1st phase MVP)

End date is exclusive
Used mainly for fixed term agreements
            
End Date 2023-12-31 expected on request in format "2023-12-30T21:59:59.999Z" or "2023-12-30T23:59:59.999+02:00"
Time zone information are inside time zone configuration and in this case it is Europe/Helsinki
This format is return in response "2023-12-30T21:59:59.999Z"

customerName.description:
Customer Name
From Customer Object
Person customer name(First, Middle, Last name) or Company customer name

invoiceNumber.description:
Invoice number must be in an unbroken sequence according to tax regulation. An invoice number doesn't necessarily need to contain only numbers it can also be letters the important is that its in an unbroken sequence.
An invoice can contain several different invoice numbers depending on the circumstances and the purposes.
In the tax regulation there is exceptions from that rule for a DSO and a RTL that share the same invoice, i.e. they can have the same invoice number and
they dont need to be in an unbroken sequence and its also exist an exception for the self-invoice where the customers invoice number must be in an unbroken sequence.
            
If the invoice number is also used as voucher number, i.e. it is used as voucher number in the accounting in the general ledger the invoice number need to be numbers and cant contain letters.
            
The invoice number can be set by the outsourcing system.

referenceInvoiceNumber.description:
Reference Invoice number
For credit invoices this has original invoice number that has been cancelled/credited

nationalBankReferenceNumber.description:
National bank reference number
The OCR number construction is different for all countries.
In Finland the 7-3-1 method is used for calculating the check digit. In Norway and Sweden Modules-10 is used for calculating check digit.

internationalBankReferenceNumber.description:
OCR number is used on the invoice as reference for the payment. The outsourcing system can set the OCR number for payment of the invoice. In Finland OCR is called Bank Reference Number
            
Invoice number and OCR number can be totally separated but it can also be used so that the invoice number is included in the OCR number and by that be used in all communication with customer and the system regarding what invoice it is.
            
The OCR number construction is different for all countries. In Finland the 7-3-1 method is used for calculating the check digit. In Norway and Sweden Modules-10 is used for calculating check digit.
            
There exist an standardized OCR reference that is intended not to country specific (RF Creditor Reference Redirected from General Information/ISO11649 - Creditor Reference ) where alphanumeric OCR reference can be used and transformed into numbers by mod-97.

virtualBankBarcode.description:
Virtual bank barcode
Concat this string with order (Vnnn...nEEEEEECCrrr...rYYMMDD)
1. V is version number 5
2. nnn...n is numeric part of the vendor's bank account number (IBAN) 16 digits
3. E is invoice total sum with VAT euros 6 digits
4. C is invoice total sum with VAT cents 2 digits
5. rrr...r is numeric part of the RF reference 23 digits
    (removing the characters "RF" from the beginning and adding zeros after the position 2 in order to have 23 characters in total) 
    e.g. RF reference RF341234561 is modified to format 34000000000000001234561
6. YYMMDD = invoice due date

invoiceReferenceText.description:
Invoice reference text
Free text e.g. to be printed/included in invoice layouts
If customer changes then reference text is no longer valid
If agreement changes, e.g. in renewal case, the reference text must still remain

invoiceVersionNumber.description:
Invoice version number
Important for re-calculate invoice several times for same period

invoiceDate.description:
Invoice data
Official date when invoice is approved, defined in invoicing process phase

dueDate.description:
Due date
Calculated based on Payment term PaymentTermId

accountingDate.description:
Accounting date
Different date for bookkeeping system based on accounting period

calculationDate.description:
Calculation date
When invoice is created

deliveryDate.description:
Delivery date
When invoice is delivered (invoice-xml sent to operator)

Invoice sum without VAT
Calculated from invoice rows included in invoice

totalAmount.description:
Invoice sum with VAT
Calculated from invoice rows included in invoice

vat.description:
Invoice VAT
Calculated from invoice rows included in invoice

startDate.description:
Invoicing period start date
Start date is inclusive
            
Start date 2023-01-01 expected on request in format "2022-12-31T22:00:00.000Z" or "2023-01-01T00:00:00.000+02:00"
Time zone information are inside time zone configuration and in this case it is Europe/Helsinki
This format is return in response "2022-12-31T22:00:00.000Z"

endDate.description:
Invoicing period end date
End date is exclusive
Used mainly for fixed term agreements
            
End Date 2023-12-31 expected on request in format "2023-12-30T21:59:59.999Z" or "2023-12-30T23:59:59.999+02:00"
Time zone information are inside time zone configuration and in this case it is Europe/Helsinki
This format is return in response "2023-12-30T21:59:59.999Z"

In the tax regulation there is exceptions from that rule for a DSO and a RTL that share the same invoice, i.e. they can have the same invoice number and
they dont need to be in an unbroken sequence and its also exist an exception for the self-invoice where the customers invoice number must be in an unbroken sequence.

Invoice status is updated by Cloud-CIS

Invoices that are in Approved, Sent to distribution, Delivered or Cancelled status have invoice number and cant be deleted, they need to be cancelled (reversed).

A grace period is a set length of time after the due date during which payment may be made without penalty.
A grace period, typically of 15 days, is commonly included in mortgage loan and insurance contracts.

ProductComponentTypeApiModel.description:
Product component type.
Metered The product component is evaluated for each incoming meter value of type CIS.Core.Api.Model.ProductComponents.Requests.ProductComponentRequest.MeteringType, which must be set. Typical use is together with CIS.Core.Api.Model.ProductComponents.Requests.ProductComponentRequest.InvoicingType=CIS.Core.Api.Model.Products.InvoicingTypeApiModel.Continuous. CIS.Core.Api.Model.ProductComponents.Requests.ProductComponentRequest.QuantityExpression and CIS.Core.Api.Model.ProductComponents.Requests.ProductComponentRequest.PriceExpression must be specified.
CIS.Core.Api.Model.ProductComponents.ProductComponentTypeApiModel.Tiered Not supported yet
CIS.Core.Api.Model.ProductComponents.ProductComponentTypeApiModel.Volume Typical use is together with CIS.Core.Api.Model.ProductComponents.Requests.ProductComponentRequest.InvoicingType=CIS.Core.Api.Model.Products.InvoicingTypeApiModel.EndOfPeriod. CIS.Core.Api.Model.ProductComponents.Requests.ProductComponentRequest.AmountExpression must be set.
CIS.Core.Api.Model.ProductComponents.ProductComponentTypeApiModel.Recurring Typical use is together with CIS.Core.Api.Model.ProductComponents.Requests.ProductComponentRequest.InvoicingType=CIS.Core.Api.Model.Products.InvoicingTypeApiModel.StartOfPeriod. CIS.Core.Api.Model.ProductComponents.Requests.ProductComponentRequest.Recurrence and CIS.Core.Api.Model.ProductComponents.Requests.ProductComponentRequest.AmountExpression must be set.
CIS.Core.Api.Model.ProductComponents.ProductComponentTypeApiModel.OneTime Not supported yet
CIS.Core.Api.Model.ProductComponents.ProductComponentTypeApiModel.Event Not supported yet

ZZ=no code - other

In case of an electricity delivery agreement, the invoicing method should be Supplier invoices both.
If invoicing method is anything else than separate invoicing, the accounting point DSO must allow combined invoicing.
